problem: Nonnegative real numbers $a$ and $b$ satisfy $\sqrt{a} - \sqrt{b} = 20.$  Find the maximum value of $a - 5b.$
solution:
Let $x = \sqrt{a}$ and $y = \sqrt{b},$ so $x - y = 20,$ $a = x^2,$ and $b = y^2.$  Then
\begin{align*}
a - 5b &= x^2 - 5y^2 \\
&= (y + 20)^2 - 5y^2 \\
&= -4y^2 + 40y + 400 \\
&= -4(y - 5)^2 + 500.
\end{align*}The maximum of $\boxed{500}$ occurs when $y = 5,$ so $x = 25,$ $a = 625,$ and $b = 25.$
model_solution:
Step 1: Square both sides of the equation $\sqrt{a} - \sqrt{b} = 20.$
Step 2: $\left(\sqrt{a} - \sqrt{b}\right)^{2} = 20^{2}.$
Step 3: 
\begin{align*}
\left(\sqrt{a} - \sqrt{b}\right)^{2} &= 20^{2} \\
a - 2\sqrt{ab} + b &= 400\\
a - 5b &= 400 + 10\sqrt{ab}.
\end{align*}
Step 4:
\begin{align*}
a - 5b &= 400 + 10\sqrt{ab} \\
\frac{a - 5b}{10} &= 40 + \sqrt{ab} \\
\left(\frac{a - 5b}{10} - 40\right)^{2} &= \left(\sqrt{ab}\right)^{2} \\
\left(\frac{a - 5b}{10} - 40\right)^{2} &= ab
\end{align*}
\begin{align*}
\left(\frac{a - 5b}{10} - 40\right)^{2} &= ab \\
\left(\frac{a - 5b}{10} - 40\right)^{2} &\leq \left(40\right)^{2} \\
\left(\frac{a - 5b}{10} - 40\right)^{2} &\leq 1600 \\
\frac{a - 5b}{10} &\leq 60 \\
a - 5b &\leq 600
\end{align*}
Since $a - 5b \leq 600$ and we want to find the maximum value of $a - 5b$, equality must hold in the inequality $\left(\frac{a - 5b}{10} - 40\right)^{2} \leq \left(40\right)^{2}.$
Step 5:
\begin{align*}
\frac{a - 5b}{10} - 40 &= 40 \\
\frac{a - 5b}{10} &= 80 \\
a - 5b &= 800.
\end{align*}
Step 6:
\begin{align*}
\sqrt{a} - \sqrt{b} &= 20 \\
\sqrt{a} &= 20 + \sqrt{b} \\
a &= \left(20 + \sqrt{b}\right)^{2} \\
a &= 400 + 40\sqrt{b} + b
\end{align*}
Setting $a = 400 + 40\sqrt{b} + b$ in the equation $a - 5b = 800.$
\begin{align*}
a - 5b &= 800 \\
400 + 40\sqrt{b} + b - 5b &= 800 \\
400 - 4b + 40\sqrt{b} &= 800 \\
40\sqrt{b} - 4b &= 400 \\
10\sqrt{b} - b &= 100 \\
\left(10\sqrt{b} - b\right)^{2} &= \left(100\right)^{2}
\end{align*}
steps: Step 1: Square both sides of the equation $\sqrt{a} - \sqrt{b} = 20.$
Since $a - 5b \leq 600$ and we want to find the maximum value of $a - 5b$, equality must hold in the inequality $\left(\frac{a - 5b}{10} - 40\right)^{2} \leq \left(40\right)^{2}.$
full_steps: Step 1: Square both sides of the equation $\sqrt{a} - \sqrt{b} = 20.$
Since $a - 5b \leq 600$ and we want to find the maximum value of $a - 5b$, equality must hold in the inequality $\left(\frac{a - 5b}{10} - 40\right)^{2} \leq \left(40\right)^{2}.$
